required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Higher vs. Lower Dose Heparin for PCI
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Trial of Higher vs. Lower Dose Heparin for PCI

brief_summary.textblock: HD PCI is a multicenter, randomized, registry-based, cluster crossover design trial of higher dose versus lower dose heparin in patients undergoing elective percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of HD PCI is to compare the effect of a policy of higher dose heparin (100 U/kg) use to a policy of lower dose heparin (70 U/kg) use on death, myocardial infarction (MI) or target vessel revascularization (TVR) in patients undergoing elective percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with any of the following: death, myocardial infarction or target vessel revascularization

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with major bleeding
Number of Participants with any of the following: death, myocardial infarction, target vessel revascularization or major bleeding

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with either of the following: death or myocardial infarction
Number of Participants with definite stent thrombosis

arm_group.arm_group_label: Higher Dose Unfractionated Heparin Treatment Period
arm_group.description: A centre wide policy of administering 100 U/kg bolus of intravenous unfractionated heparin (UFH) for elective percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) procedures will be implemented during the Higher Dose UFH treatment period.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Lower Dose Unfractionated Heparin Treatment Period
arm_group.description: A centre wide policy of administering 70 U/kg bolus of intravenous UFH for elective PCI procedures will be implemented during the Lower Dose UFH treatment period.

intervention.description: Centre wide policy of administering 100 U/kg bolus of intravenous UFH for elective PCI procedures
intervention.arm_group_label: Higher Dose Unfractionated Heparin Treatment Period

intervention.description: Centre wide policy of administering 70 U/kg bolus of intravenous UFH for elective PCI procedures
intervention.arm_group_label: Lower Dose Unfractionated Heparin Treatment Period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing elective PCI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- Planned chronic total occlusion PCI
- Non-resident precluding follow up through local registries
Hospital (Cluster) Eligibility Criteria
Hospitals will be eligible to participate if they meet the following criteria:
- Submit PCI procedure data to a compatible registry that is able to provide data for the trial
- Site agrees to manage patients as per the higher or lower dose heparin policy in place during the given crossover period
